column1: tayhuk kuwing cu mapitu’ pincapngan cu wagi’ i papatiqan cu sawni’.
column2: I arrived at school at seven today.
column3: 我今天七點到學校。

column1: papateq la, mawp i papatiqan i papsibaq, kumaal i pancang maha:“ca’rux! tubunani i papsibaq!”
column2: It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”
column3: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」

column1: kumaal cami kahabaag maha, “lawkah su’ papsibaq.”
column2: We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”
column3: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」

column1: mateq ga, pasibaqan cami ni papsibaq cu lalpu ka kayi’ na Itaal.
column2: In class, the teacher taught us the Tayal language of numbers.
column3: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。

column1: galgan niyam lumpu i papsibaq, maquwas cami uwi cu quwas na lalpu.
column2: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.
column3: 我們跟著老師唸，我們也唱了數字歌。

column1: payux ku baqun mu ka kayi’ na Itaal.
column2: I have learned many Tayal languages.
column3: 我學會好多族語。

column1: musa’ kuwing mateq kariariax, makibaq kuwing kariariax cu kayi’ na Itaal, papapung mu i yaya’.
column2: I go to school every day, I learn the Tayal language every day, and I want to tell my mother.
column3: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。

column1: ralu’ mu ga Kaynu’.
column2: My name is Kaynu’.
column3: 我的名字是Kaynu’。

column1: ralu’ ni yaba’ mu ga Baycu’.
column2: My dad’s name is Baycu’.
column3: 我爸爸的名字是Baycu’。

column1: ralu’ ni yaya’ mu ga Iwal.
column2: My mother’s name is Iwal.
column3: 我媽媽的名字是Iwal。

column1: magalpu kaal mu kaal ka hani.
column2: I am 10 years old.
column3: 我今年10歲。

column1: kiya qutux qumisuwan na mamaliku mu, ralu’ niya’ ga Bawtu’, magalpu cu qutux kaal niya’ kaal ka hani.
column2: I have a brother, his name is Bawtu’, he is 11 years old.
column3: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Bawtu’，他今年11歲。

column1: maglu cami mateq i qutux papatiqan.
column2: We study in the same school.
column3: 我們在同一間學校讀書。

column1: balayq mu ki qumisuwan na mamaliku ku maquwas.
column2: Both my brother and I like to sing.
column3: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。

column1: balayq mu ku lumanguy, muhngeq kuwing ga, maglu cami ka qutux cu imuwag musa’ i lumanguy.
column2: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.
column3: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。

column1: balayq mu ku makasbabaq cu giqas ka rawin, naki cami maglu musa’ i maquwas ru lumanguy.
column2: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.
column3: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。

column1: ulaqi’ kuwing na Itaal.
column2: I am an Itaal child.
column3: 我是泰雅族的小孩。

column1: kiya i Tabilas ku imuwag niyam.
column2: Our family lives in Tabilas.
column3: 我們家住在Tabilas。

column1: imagal cami ka qutux cu imuwag.
column2: There are five people in our family.
column3: 我們家共有五個人。

column1: tugal cami ka matasasuwayi’ ka qutux cu imuwag.
column2: There are three brothers and sisters in our family.
column3: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。

column1: masiqun kuwing ki yaba’, yaya’, qumisuwan na mamaliku ru qumisuwan na kanayril.
column2: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.
column3: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。

column1: ibabaweq i yaba’ mu, kinsac i yaba’ mu.
column2: My father is tall and he is a policeman.
column3: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。

column1: mahikang i yaya’ mu, kuwisang i yaya’ mu.
column2: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.
column3: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。

column1: makiya imuwag i yaba’ ga makaal cami na kayi’ na Itaal.
column2: My father speaks the ethnic language with us at home.
column3: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。

column1: muhngeq i hahangiqan gabagan ga mamati’ cami musa’ i tinqalangan.
column2: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.
column3: 我們暑假都會回部落。

column1: maglu cami kina ququmisuwan rumakaap cu taka.
column2: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.
column3: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。

column1: balayq mu cubalay ku qutux mu cu imuwag.
column2: I like our family very much.
column3: 我很喜歡我們家的人。

column1: maglu kuwing ki yaya’ musa’ magunawu’ cu sawni’.
column2: I went out with my mother today.
column3: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。

column1: mataseq a kaal cu qaliyan, ini’ kagihaaq, ini’ uwi uw kakilux, mashahiyaw a bayhu.
column2: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.
column3: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。

column1: asi cami pasisamag ca rawq i maneq cu miyenpaw, halhul tagacbu’ ca hihihi’ ku wagi’.
column2: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.
column3: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。

column1: matanah a kaal la cu minaneq la.
column2: In the afternoon, the sky turned red.
column3: 下午，天空變紅了。

column1: paqucan mu i yaya’ mha : “micuwa’ ka matanah a kaal la?”
column2: I asked my mother why the sky is red.
column3: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。

column1: kumaal i yaya’ maha, “kiiy ma’uwah a rahuwal ka bayhu la.”
column2: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.
column3: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。

column1: ukas a hamhum ca kaal cu gabiyan, pakahtu a buliqu la.
column2: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.
column3: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。

column1: mausa’ cami i imuwag uwi la.
column2: We were going home too.
column3: 我們也要回家了。

column1: sikaal mu cuku buliqu ku kisleq mu cu muwah kuwing imuwag maha,
column2: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,
column3: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，

column1: “muwa’ na iqaat ma’uwah a bayhu ka mamati’, mausa’ kuwing i magunawu’ lawwi.”
column2: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.
column3: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。

column1: kiya i kiyl na imuwag niyam ku papatiqan mu, humakay kuwing kariariariax i musa’ papatiqan, muwah imuwag ga humakay uwi.
column2: My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.
column3: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。

column1: ini’ ka rahuwal ku papatiqan niyam, ini’ ka habaag ku mateq, makbabaq cami kahabaag.
column2: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.
column3: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。

column1: masautu’ cami kahabaag ka ulullaqi’ i paptaliyuman, maglu i magunawu’ cu mari’, maglu i maskakaru’.
column2: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.
column3: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。

column1: maglu ki cami magunawu’ uwi ku papsibaq, asiga magqutux cu imuwag ku papatiqan.
column2: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.
column3: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。

column1: cumaping cami kariariax, capingun niyam cu mauba’ cubalay ku papatiqan.
column2: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.
column3: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。

column1: kiya ku ruma’ ga cumawm cu tuhung, karuma’ ga cumaping cu rawq.
column2: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.
column3: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。

column1: capingun niyam kahabaag ku iquiqung na papatiqan, mapararag cami kahabaag, mauba’ cubalay kariariax ku papatiqan.
column2: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.
column3: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。

column1: minusa’ kuwing tinqalangan maskakaru’ ki yutas cuhisa’.
column2: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.
column3: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。

column1: ingsu cami cubalay ini’ pakitaal la, lungulungun mu cubalay hiya’.
column2: We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.
column3: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。

column1: talan kuwing ni yutas ru paqaniqan kuwing niya’ cu bahat, panubuwan kuwing niya’ cu cha(外來語-客).
column2: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.
column3: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。

column1: lalbing cubalay ku pinumuwa’ ni yutas ka bahat, sahahiya’ cubalay i niqun.
column2: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.
column3: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。

column1: balayq mu uwi ku cha ni yutas, balayq uwi i nubun.
column2: I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.
column3: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。

column1: pakuriax laga, gumlu kuwing i tumahuk cu kakriaxun ki yaki’.
column2: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.
column3: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。

column1: payux cubalay ku tinahuk ni yaki’, kiya a quleh, waylung, rilum ru aang na apit.
column2: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and flying squirrel soup.
column3: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有飛鼠湯。

column1: kumnuriax laru’, musa’ cami kumiku’ cu paruxaw i papmuwaan cu paparuxaw.
column2: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.
column3: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。

column1: payux inagal ni yaki’ ka bunga’, cayi’ ru qinu, sipaaras kuwing niya’ muwah imuwag.
column2: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.
column3: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。

column1: mapugagay cami ga, kalun mu maha wahay cimu mitaal lawwi i babaw niya’.
column2: I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.
column3: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。

column1: rasun cami ni papsibaq i aangayan cu qaqasinu cu sawni’, tibalung cami i balihun mabaynay cu aangay.
column2: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.
column3: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。

column1: mawp cami aangayan cu qaqasinu laru, kumaal i papsibaq maha, “pug ga kakbahneq, sug ga quruquru’, angay nanak cimu.”
column2: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back
column3: so you can visit them yourself.""
column4: 進入動物園後，老師說:「前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。」

column1: kaicuun mu ku quru’, kahi’ kuwing ini’ kitaal cu quruquru’.
column2: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.
column3: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。

column1: payux ku talan mu ka kabahneq, manbahaag ca babaw na kahuneq, manbahaag i kiya manbahaag i runi, talan mu uwi ku puuk ka kiya i maqilaap ca kuug na kahuneq.
column2: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.
column3: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。

column1: kiya a tasiyang, ramayi’ ru wakli’ i aangayan cu qaqasinu, iqaat kuwing minitaal na’ aring cunga’ cu qaqasinu ka hani, talan sawni’ laru maqas cubalay a qisleq.
column2: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.
column3: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。

column1: payux a ingal mu ka qalimu’ na qariwal, papkitaal mu i yaba’ ki yaya’.
column2: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.
column3: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。

column1: paglu kuwing ki yaba’, yaya’ muwah i babaw niya’.
column2: Next time I will come with my parents.
column3: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。

column1: muhngeq kahani ga, masa’ kuwing ki iyah i Taytung maskakaru’ ki mama’.
column2: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.
column3: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。

column1: manaaring cami i Taype’ gumlu cu kulu’ na hapuneq musa’ i Taytung.
column2: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.
column3: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。

column1: tayhuk cami i Taytung ga, miray na kulu’ muwah autuan cu kulu’ masacka’ cami i mama’.
column2: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.
column3: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。

column1: ini’ paktatuhi’ cku imuwag ni mama’ ku autuan cu kulu’, miray cu kulu’ ga cupilapilag ru tayhuk la.
column2: The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.
column3: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。

column1: kiya a wahti’ ka sasaanan cu qaqasinu i beh na imuwag ni mama’, maglu cami gumlu na tamayray musa’ i sasaanan cu qaqasinu.
column2: There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.
column3: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。

column1: rasun cami ni mama’ suman cu kating, miyt ru gumlu cu ramayi’ i sasaanan cu qaqasinu.
column2: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.
column3: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。

column1: gabiyan laru, musa’ cami maneq i naniqan qalang quwis.
column2: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.
column3: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。

column1: payux a kulu’ i qalang quwis, ru gumlu cami na utubay musa’ kiya.
column2: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.
column3: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。

column1: mateqru’ maneq papagiyay cami ga, quriqun ku utubay la, asi cami glu cu bas’ musa’ imuwag la.
column2: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.
column3: 吃飽飯要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車回家了。

column1: tayhuk cami Taype’ kahani la, ini’ baqi kiiy luwan ni mama’ ku utubay la qu?
column2: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.
column3: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有？

column1: kiya i Tabilas ku imuwag niyam cu ulaqi’ kuwing na’, mateq kuwing laru, magnuhyi’ cami i Miyawli’ la, aring kiya maqinux cami quwis ruu’ kahani.
column2: When we were young, our family lived in Tabilas. After I started school, we moved to Miyawli’ and have been living in the city ever since.
column3: 小時候我們家住在Tabilas，上學以後，就搬到了Miyawli’，一直在都市裡生活。

column1: ru’ cu muhngeq gabagan cku kaal kahani ga, muwah kuwing ki yulah mitaal maskakaru’ cku nanabakis i tinqalangan, miki baqun mu tikay ku Gagagaga’ na Itaal nanak.
column2: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.
column3: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。

column1: mamaspat kinamlapgan a kaal nku nabakis la, ga’ ulaaqi’ na’ i talan.
column2: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.
column3: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。

column1: paqucan mu mha, “nanuwan ku kayi’ ka baqun su’? ” balayq cubalabalay a kayi’ niya’ na Matu’uwal, baaq uwi kumaal cu kayi’ na Siputu’ ru kayi’ na Gipun.
column2: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Atayal, as well as Hakka and Japanese.
column3: 我問他會哪些語言，他的汶水泰雅語說得很流利，也會說客家話和日本話。

column1: paqucan mu hiya’ ru baqun mu la, aqumuwani ka minkibaq cu ulaqi’ na’ hiya’ cu kayi’ na Gipun, Itaal uwi ku glu niya’, ru habaag a Siputu’ ka baqun niya’ cu matawwaw, kahi’ payux ku kayi’ ka baqun niya’ i sipakaal.
column2: I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Atayal, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.
column3: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太也是泰雅族人，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。

column1: payux ku sipanqaquu’ nku nabakis ka Gagagaga’ na qaqaluwaap cu maskakaru’ cami.
column2: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.
column3: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。

column1: bali niyam kiiy baqun muung kahabaag, ga’ alan niyam na soci’ cu qalimu’, ru pakbalayq lawwi nabalbalayqun i muung.
column2: Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.
column3: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。

column1: ini’ baqibaqi cuqaang ku Gaga’ nanak cu ukaqi’, sikitaal cku Itaal kuwing ga, ini’ kabalbalayq cubalay a kisleq.
column2: When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.
column3: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。

column1: ararruwa payux tikay ku baqun lru’, ararruwa i baqun mha, masqaqutux cu ini’ cubalay packa’ kin cuquleq ku Itaal, sipturahu mu cubalay uwi.
column2: The more I know, the more I feel that being a Atayal is unique and something to be proud of.
column3: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為原住民族，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。

column1: ma’uwah imuwag i gabgabiyan kisa’ i suwayi’ na mamaliku la.
column2: My younger brother is going home this evening.
column3: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。

column1: musa’ kuwing ki yaki’ i mabainasan cu raramat mabaynay cu waylung, tatahuk i suwayi’ na mamaliku i kumgabayan.
column2: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.
column3: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。

column1: kiya kahabaag a mica na’ kiniku’ ka paruxaw i babinasan cu raramat cu hinasun niyam.
column2: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.
column3: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。

column1: mabaynay cami cu kungsincay, saku ru caypu ka matanah.
column2: We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.
column3: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。

column1: humuwaw ku kiya matibaynay cu uquuqu’ i kiyl mha, “lalbing cubalay ku pangran ru qaym mu, baynay tikay ga!”
column2: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”
column3: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」

column1: mabaynay cami cu pangran ru qaym la.
column2: We bought pineapples and peaches.
column3: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。

column1: humaynas cami cku babinasan cu hyi’ ga, kumaal ku lawpan mha, “nanuwan ku babinasun su’? rahuwal cu magnabalay ku waykung sawni’, tugal kabhul i qutux.”
column2: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”
column3: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」

column1: mamati’ cuqaang mha i yaki’, paqucan niya’ ku lawpan mha, “pakabalayq i mahnuk tikay? ”
column2: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.
column3: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。

column1: asikinaga mahnuk cubalay la, iqat babaqun i mahahuwi’ lga mha kumaal ku lawpan.
column2: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.
column3: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。

column1: kumaal ku tagi kiyl ka lawpan mha, “uwah mabaynay cu quleh mu, rahuwal cu mahnuk ku quleh mu.”
column2: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.
column3: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。

column1: babaw niya’ lru, mabaynay cami cu waylung ru quleh uwi, tahkun cu qutux cu naniqan ka raramat musa’ imuwag la.
column2: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.
column3: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。

column1: ingasu nagaun la, ini’ saluwi uwi a kaal la.
column2: After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.
column3: 等了好久，天也黑了。

column1: muwah a kayi’ na qanawan ni suwayi’ na mamaliku mha, “asipatubaah aqeh muhngeq ku hitay la, asiki hahungiqan babaw lga ma’uhwa ci la.”
column2: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.
column3: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。

column1: payux ku tinahuk laru, asi ta’ patgiquni i maneq la mha i yaki’.
column2: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!
column3: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!

column1: kurunguun niyam ku rawirawin, maglu kumnagabaiyan ku makasiusiun ca naniqan ka raramat.
column2: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.
column3: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。

column1: kiya caxa’ baays mi mateq ka Kaynu’, mamati’ umungi’ i maras cu qaraqarax.
column2: I have a classmate named Kaynu’, he often forgets to bring things.
column3: 我有一個同學叫Kaynu’，他常常忘記帶東西。

column1: mateq ga, kabawx ki baays mateq cu papateq, papawng cu pinateq quqa ruwas ka papatiqan.
column2: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.
column3: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。

column1: manaxleq, magnapusal, magnatuu’, pakabaxan nha’ cu qaraqarax.
column2: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.
column3: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。

column1: asikinaga, kiya qutux hmut niya’ ka aqeh, kabawx cu qaraqarax ga mamati’ ini’ pasayu.
column2: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.
column3: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。

column1: babaw niya’ ru ini’ nha’ pakikabaxi cu qaraqarax la.
column2: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.
column3: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。

column1: riax ka qutux, maglu cami kahabaag musa’ i magunawu’.
column2: One day, we all went on an outing together.
column3: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。

column1: maki musa’ latanux Kaynu’ cu makiya i raneq, ga’ umungi’ maras cu cacawm cu qaqutian hiya’.
column2: On the way, Kaynu’ wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.
column3: 路途中，Kaynu’想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。

column1: kabawx kinku baays niya’ mateq cu cacawm cu qaqutian, asikinaga ciyukun nha’ kahabaag mha, “ini’ cu aras uwi yu!”
column2: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.
column3: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。

column1: maimag mangilis cu manata’ i Kaynu’ mha, “micuwa’ cimu kahabaag ka ini’ pakabaxani kuwing cu cacawm cu qaqutian!”
column2: Kaynu’ burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!
column3: Kaynu’急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!

column1: kalun nku baays mateq mha, “aqeh gi ini’ su’ aras nanak, anauwi ga sipkabawx su’ cu qaraqarax ga, ini’ su’ pasiyugi kariariax!”
column2: The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!
column3: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!

column1: kincasan, magagaaboq tayhuk papatiqan i Kaynu’, sipasayu kahabaag ni Kaynu’ ku qaraqarax ka kinabaxan niya’ kinku baays niya’ kahabaag la.
column2: The next day at school, Kaynu’ arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.
column3: 隔天上學，Kaynu’ 很早就到學校了，Kaynu’ 把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。

column1: situbun niya’ kahabaag ku baybaays niya’ mha, “paaras kuwing cubalay cu qaraqarax mu nanak i babaw niya’ la, ru mahuway cimu ka sisiwaal mamu pakabawx kuwing ku qaraqarax mamu cku riax ka ini’ ka isting. mahuway cimu! mahuway cimu cubalabalay!”
column2: Kaynu’ apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.
column3: Kaynu’向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。謝謝你們！真的非常謝謝你們！

column1: paqaluwaap na itaal i tinqalangan i yaba’ mu.
column2: My dad is a hunter of the tribe.
column3: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。

column1: cu ulaqi’ cu na’ ga, umubu’ cu takis ru mahangal na patus humakay i mahantan yaba’ ki mama’.
column2: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.
column3: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。

column1: saaluwan lga, awni nha’ rasan lku qinaluwaap nha’ ka qaqasinu.
column2: At daybreak, they returned with their prey.
column3: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。

column1: mahananu’ ga bawwak na lahulahu, mahananu’ ga apit, iy makiya a gilaqung uwi.
column2: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.
column3: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。

column1: gayhun nha’ i sugagay gawng ru siqasu kahabaag cku itaal i tiqalangan.
column2: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.
column3: 他們會在村口叉路的溪邊將獵物分分解切好後，分享給部落族人。

column1: mamati’ mi pakibugan i yaba’ mha paglu ci musa’ qumaluwaap uwi.
column2: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.
column3: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，我也要跟著去打獵。

column1: kumaal yaba’ mha rahuwal kuwing lga rarasun cu niya’.
column2: Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.
column3: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。

column1: baaq uwi kabalay cu sasiyahing cu qaqasinu ku mamaliku i tinqalangan, kabalay cu tatiruweq ca wariyung, tatiruweq ca kukuy.
column2: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making head-hold traps and leg-hold traps.
column3: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，製作套頸或套腳陷阱。

column1: baaq i puquluwang i yaba’, kumaal i yaba’ mha, tatiruweq cu gilaqung ku hani, asiki nabalbalayqun mitaal ku tuqi na qasinu, kakbahneq, sukuun cku hahakayan na qasinu ku quluwang.
column2: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.
column3: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

column1: naki ti ini’ kanga’ gumlu kinku nanabakis musa’ i qumaluwaap mha cu ru’, makaruux ci makibaq kabalay cu sasiyahing cu qbuqbux kariariax, ini’ kaingasu ru’ tiruweq cubalay lku sinku’ mu.
column2: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.
column3: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。

column1: talan ni yaba’ ru kalun cu niya’ mha pakacapaang kuwing na patqaqasinu inga’’
column2: Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.
column3: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。

column1: rahuwal ci la kahani, mapanga’ ci cu tawnux ru saliy mu, gumlu ci yaba’ musa’ qumaluwaap la.
column2: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.
column3: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。

column1: muwah tinqalangan ga, siqasu kahabaag ku tiniruwrq cku qutux cu glu.
column2: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.
column3: 回部落時，將獵物和族人們分享。

column1: kumaal yaba’ mha, asi ta’ ki situbun ku huway na nanabakis, bayqan ta’ niya’ cu tiniruweq ka payux.
column2: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.
column3: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。

column1: masicuqi’ cu musa’ ’i’ matas ’i’ kasasanan la.
column2: I was late for school this morning.
column3: 我早上上學遲到了。

column1: musa’ cu i’ papatasan ga’, umungi cu maras cu’ kabang.
column2: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
column3: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。

column1: ini’ cu aras cu’ ani nanuwan ka’ qaraqarax.
column2: I didn't bring anything with me.
column3: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。

column1: matas cu ga’, maglug cu ki’ rawin mu mital cu’ ruwas.
column2: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.
column3: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。

column1: macacpung cu ga’, kabaxan cu na’ rawin mu ku’ papatiq ru’ cacawam cu’ pinatiq.
column2: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.
column3: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。

column1: kalun cu nku’ papasibaq maha’, “nabuwibuwi ’i’ tihway babaw niya’ laxi ku’ masicuqi lawwi la.”
column2: The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""
column3: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」

column1: Yumin ku’ capaang mu na’ rawin. ulaqi’ nku’ Itaal ’i’ hiya’ uwi.
column2: My good friend’s name is Yumin, and he is also an Tayal child.
column3: 我的好朋友叫Yumin，他也是泰雅族的小孩。

column1: maglug cami matas cku’ tinqalangan na’ Tabilas.
column2: We study together in the Tabilas tribe.
column3: 我們一起在圓墩部落讀書。

column1: maglug cami mung cu’ kuss ki’ nanabakis ’i’ kariariax. baq cami kumaal cu’ kai’ na’ Itaal.
column2: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Tayal proficiently.
column3: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說泰雅語。

column1: ibabawiq ru’ kithu cu. irarawq ru’ mahikang ’i’ Yumin.
column2: I am tall and overweight, while Yumin is short and thin.
column3: 我很高也很胖，Yumin很矮也很瘦。

column1: lawkah cubalay ’i’ Yumin, balaiq naha’ kahabag ’i’ hiya’.
column2: Yumin is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.
column3: Yumin很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。

column1: yuntunghuwei nku’ papatasan ’i’ sawni, payux ku’ papakal nku’ papatasan na’ macacpung.
column2: Today was the school’s sports day, and the school organized many competitions.
column3: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。

column1: kiya ku’ humuluy cu’ siniyug, kumcacri’ cu’ mari’, mataliyum, yugi’ ru’ cumbu’ cu’ sali’.
column2: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
column3: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。

column1: macacpung cu ’i’ mataliyum.
column2: I participated in the running competition.
column3: 我比賽跑步。

column1: atuna’ mataliyum cu ga’, mataku’ cu la. masiramux ku’ tari’ mu.
column2: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.
column3: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。

column1: asikina ga’ macaqrux cu ru’ ini cu hngaw ’i’ mataliyum.
column2: But I stood up and continued running forward.
column3: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。

column1: tayhuk cu cku’ langaag ga’, maqas kahabag ku’ itaal.
column2: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.
column3: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。

column1: ani cu ini agal cu’ tigiqutux ga’, asikinaga maqas ci cubalay gi’ naqalun mu ku’ macacpung la.
column2: Although I didn’t get first place, I’m glad because I completed the race.
column3: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。

column1: minusa’ cu ki’ yaba’ mi mitaal ’i’ mama’ mu cu’ hisa’.
column2: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.
column3: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。

column1: mapangih ku’ kukuy ni’ mama’ la.
column2: My uncle injured his foot.
column3: 叔叔的腳受傷了。

column1: kalun cami niya’ maha’, mabuka’ ru kiya’ qutux a’ kug cku’ rinamuwaag na’ imuwaag.
column2: He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.
column3: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。

column1: kiya’ kabalay cu’ rinamuwaag na’ imuwaag ’i’ hiya’ ga’, asi papsihuwaw cku’ rinamuwaag na’ imuwaag.
column2: He fell off the roof while repairing it.
column3: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。

column1: rasun ni’ yaba’ ku’ hi’ na’ kating ru pinnong. sibiq niya’ ’i’ mama’ la.
column2: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.
column3: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。

column1: maskakaru’ cu ki’ mama’ cku’ qaqilpan. payux ku’ sikaal cu niya’ ka’ kus.
column2: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.
column3: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。

column1: ini cu pagiyay na’ ga’, tarahuwalun cu ni’ mama’ maha’, ibabawiq ru ara’ruwa’ si’ magbatunux la.
column2: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.
column3: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。

column1: kumaal cu maha, “ atuna balaiq ku’ kukuy ni’ mama’ la ga’, ma’uwah ’i’ maganaw ’i’ imuwaag mu babaw niya’ uwi. ”
column2: I said, \When your foot gets better
column3: come to our house next time and visit us.\""
column4: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」

column1: cku’ kaal ka’ 2022, makaal ku’ sebu maha’, senbenceng nku’ Yencumin ga’ balaiq patasi nanaq cu’ ralu’ na’ Itaal.
column2: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.
column3: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。

column1: paqucan mi Kyusi’ na’ Baay ka’ kiya cku’ tinqalangan ka’ mugumalaq ka’ minusa’ ’i’ masina’ cu’ patasi nanaq ku’ ralu’ na’ Itaal cku’ senbenceng cku’ sebu.
column2: I interviewed Kyusi’ na’ Baay, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.
column3: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Kyusi’ na’ Baay。

column1: makaal cu ki’ hiya’ cku’ a’hangiqan ka’ hani. ma’usa’ cu mitaal ’i’ hiya’.
column2: We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.
column3: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。

column1: maskakaru’ cami ka’ hani ga’, kaalun cu niya’ ku’ ralu’ niya’ ka’ minuwah inu’. sipakababaq niya’ kuwing ku’ imuwag niya’, tinqalangan niya’.
column2: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.
column3: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。

column1: paqucan mi hiya’, micuwa’ su’ ka’ asiki yugun ku’ ralu’ su’. aqih ku’ capang ka’ pinatas cu’ cunga’ pisa’?
column2: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?
column3: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?

column1: kaalun cu niya’ maha’, aqih gi’ pinatiq nku’ Tu’iya’ ga’, ini baqi nababalaiq ’i’ papkital cu’ cuquliq ku’ ralu’ niya’, pakaal cu’ buwinah ku’ cuquliq na’ maha’, “Kyusiyenseng”. kahi payux ku’ sumsasiyaq ka’ kai’.
column2: He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Ku Xian Sheng
column3: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
column4: 他對我說，因為用中文字並不能準確的傳達他的名字，其他人還會叫他「古先生」，也因此鬧出不少笑話。

column1: kumaal ’i’ Kyusi’ na’ Baay maha’, “yani cubalay ku’ ralu’ ta’ ka’ pinatiq nku’ Yencumin. ralu’ mu ga’ yani ku’ ralu’ na’ Itaal niyam, qutux cu’ imuwaag niyam, senben niyam, wana’ ara’ruwa’ payux ku’ itaal ka’ musa’ ’i’ kumiyum cku’ ralu’ naha’ nanaq.”
column2: Kyusi’ na’ Baay said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group
column3: our family
column4: our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.\""
column5: Kyusi’ na’ Baay說：「原住民語書寫的名字才是我們真正的名字。我的名字代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人找回自己的名字。」

column1: minusa’ cu ki’ yaki’ sumku’ cu’ qaraxqarax i’ ma’a’utuan cu’ qaraxqarax cu’ hisa’. rasun ni’ yaki’ ku’ pinumuwa’ niya’ nanaq ka’ paruxaw. kabalay uwi cu’ naniqun na’ Yencumin.
column2: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.
column3: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。

column1: balaiq na’ itaal kahabag ku’ saskuan cu’ qaraxqarax ni’ yaki’. payux ku’ itaal mabaynay cu’ laciyaw ru rawhing. payux ku’ itaal muwah ’i’ maniq cu’ tinahuk niya’.
column2: Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.
column3: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和山蘇很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。

column1: balaiq cubalay ku’ tinahuk niya’ ka’ mala’ ru papah. kiya’ na uwi ku’ sitahuk na’ maqaw ka’ hi’ na’ bawak. kinsawkan ga’, payux ku’ itaal muwah ’i’ mitaal. payux ku’ itaal ka’ muwah ’i’ matibalung cku’ saskuan cu’ qaraxqarax.
column2: The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.
column3: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。

column1: tumahuk cu’ naniqun ’i’ yaki’ ga’, kiya’ cu bih niya’ humuluy cu’ itaal. kiya’ kuwing cku’ bih humuwag maha’, “pinumuwa’ nanaq ku’ paruxaw, ukas a’ iyu’ ru nabuwibuwi ’i’ uwah ’i’ mabanay ke. ”
column2: While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown
column3: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
column4: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，天然有機，趕快來買喔!」

column1: ini ka’ingasug ru binasun kahabag ku’ paruxaw niyam. kumaal ’i’ yaki’ maha’, “ulung isu’ ku’ rumag.”
column2: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""
column3: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」

column1: tiku waw ka hani ga’, baqun mu ku’ pinkibaqan na’ pinumuwa’ ru naniqun na’ Yencumin ru kinma’buk ku’ sumku’ cu’ qaraxqarax na’ waw.
column2: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.
column3: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。

column1: talan mu ’i’ yaki’ mu ka’ balaiq niya’ cubalay ku’ naniqun cu’ cunga. yani ku’ sikasalaw mu ga’.
column2: Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
column3: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
